executiveSummary: Joel Pennington, founder and CEO of Black Dot, pitched his company on Shark Tank seeking $1.5 million for 5% equity. Black Dot offers the world’s first automatic tattooing device paired with an online marketplace for licensed tattoo art. Despite interest in the innovation, the Sharks declined to invest due to unclear business planning, high valuation, and early-stage readiness.
nextSteps: Joel Pennington will likely need to refine Black Dot’s business model, clarify revenue projections, and develop a scalable leasing plan for the tattoo device before seeking further investment.
